009
010package imagingbook.common.sift.scalespace;
011
012import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
013import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianFilterSeparable;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * Represents a single scale level in a generic hierarchical scale space. See
018 * Secs. 25.1.4 for more details. Pixel data are represented as one-dimensional
019 * {@code float} arrays.
020 * This class defines no public constructor.
021 * </p>
022 * <p>
023 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
024 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
025 * </p>
026 * 
027 * @author WB
028 * @version 2022/11/20 removed FloatProcessor as superclass
029 */
030public class ScaleLevel {
031        
032        private final int width, height;
033        private final float[] data;
034        
035        private double absoluteScale;
036        
037        // ------------------------------
038        
039        /**
040         * Constructor (non-public).
041         */
042        ScaleLevel(int width, int height, float[] data, double absoluteScale) {
043                this.width = width;
044                this.height = height;
045                this.data = (data != null) ? data : new float[width * height];
046                this.absoluteScale = absoluteScale;
047        }
048        
049        /**
050         * Constructor (non-public).
051         */
052        ScaleLevel(ScaleLevel level, double absoluteScale) {
053                this(level.width, level.height, level.data.clone(), absoluteScale);
054        }
055        
056        // ------------------------------
057        
058        /**
059         * Returns the width of this scale level.
060         * @return the width of this scale level
061         */
062        public int getWidth() {
063                return this.width;
064        }
065        
066        /**
067         * Returns the height of this scale level.
068         * @return the height of this scale level
069         */
070        public int getHeight() {
071                return this.height;
072        }
073        
074        /**
075         * Returns a reference to the internal (one-dimensional)
076         * data array of this scale level.
077         * 
078         * @return to the internal data array
079         */
080        public float[] getData() {
081                return this.data;
082        }
083        
084        /**
085         * Returns the absolute scale assigned to this scale level.
086         * 
087         * @return the absolute scale
088         */
089        public double getAbsoluteScale() {
090                return this.absoluteScale;
091        }
092        
093        // ------------------------------
094        
095        /**
096         * Returns a new ImageJ {@link FloatProcessor} with the same size and pixel data
097         * as this scale level. Note that the pixel data are not duplicated but shared,
098         * i.e., subsequent modifications to the new {@link FloatProcessor} are
099         * transparent and directly affect the contents of this scale level.
100         * Thus the resulting {@link FloatProcessor} only serves as a wrapper for
101         * the data in this scale level.
102         * 
103         * @return a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance
104         */
105        FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor() {
106                return new FloatProcessor(this.width, this.height, this.data);
107        }
108        
109        /**
110         * Decimates this scale level by factor 2 in both directions and returns a 
111         * new scale level.
112         *  
113         * @return a new, decimated scale level
114         */
115        ScaleLevel decimate() { // returns a 2:1 subsampled copy of this ScaleLevel
116                final int w1 = this.getWidth();
117                final int h1 = this.getHeight();
118                final int w2 = w1 / 2;
119                final int h2 = h1 / 2;
120                
121                // new (decimated) level has the same absolute scale:
122                ScaleLevel level2 = new ScaleLevel(w2, h2, null, this.absoluteScale);
123                // resample data:
124                for (int v2 = 0 ; v2 < h2; v2++) {
125                        int v1 = 2 * v2;
126                        for (int u2 = 0 ; u2 < w2; u2++) {
127                                int u1 = 2 * u2;
128                                level2.setValue(u2, v2, this.getValue(u1, v1));
129                        }
130                }
131                return level2; //new ScaleLevel(w2, h2, pixels2, absoluteScale);
132        }
133        
134        // sometimes we need to set the scale after instantiation:
135        void setAbsoluteScale(double sigma) {
136                this.absoluteScale = sigma;
137        }
138        
139        /**
140         * Returns the element value at the specified position of this scale level.
141         * An exception is thrown if the position is outside the scale level's
142         * boundaries.
143         * 
144         * @param u horizontal position
145         * @param v vertical position
146         * @return the element value
147         */
148        public float getValue(int u, int v) {
149                return this.data[v * this.width + u];
150        }
151        
152        /**
153         * Sets the element value at the specified position of this scale level.
154         * An exception is thrown if the position is outside the scale level's
155         * boundaries.
156         * 
157         * @param u horizontal position
158         * @param v vertical position
159         * @param val the new element value
160         */
161        private void setValue(int u, int v, float val) {
162                this.data[v * this.width + u] = val;
163        }
164        
165        /**
166         * Collects and returns the 3x3 neighborhood values at this scale level 
167         * at center position (u,v). The result is stored in the supplied 3x3 array.
168         * 
169         * @param u horizontal position
170         * @param v vertical position
171         * @param nh the 3x3 array where to insert the neighborhood values 
172         */
173        void get3x3Neighborhood(final int u, final int v, final float[][] nh) {
174                for (int i = 0, x = u - 1; i < 3; i++, x++) {
175                        for (int j = 0, y = v - 1; j < 3; j++, y++) {
176                                nh[i][j] = this.getValue(x, y);
177                        }
178                }
179        }
180        
181        /**
182         * Calculates the gradient at the specified scale level position in polar form.
183         * The results (gradient magnitude and direction) are placed in the supplied
184         * 2-element array.
185         * 
186         * @param u    horizontal position
187         * @param v    vertical position
188         * @param grad a 2-element array for gradient magnitude and direction
189         */
190        public void getGradientPolar(int u, int v, final double[] grad) {
191                final double grad_x = this.getValue(u+1, v) - this.getValue(u-1, v);    // x-component of local gradient
192                final double grad_y = this.getValue(u, v+1) - this.getValue(u, v-1);    // y-component of local gradient
193                grad[0] = Math.hypot(grad_x, grad_y);                                           // local gradient magnitude (E)
194                grad[1] = Math.atan2(grad_y, grad_x);                                           // local gradient direction (phi)
195        }
196        
197        
198        /**
199         * Applies a Gaussian filter to this scale level, which is
200         * modified.
201         * 
202         * @param sigma the width of the Gaussian
203         */
204        void filterGaussian(double sigma) {
205                FloatProcessor fp = this.toFloatProcessor();
206                new GaussianFilterSeparable(sigma).applyTo(fp);
207        }
208        
209        // ---------------------------------------
210        
211        @Override
212        public String toString() {
213                return String.format("%s[w=%d h=%d absScale=%.4f]", getClass().getSimpleName(), width, height, absoluteScale);
214        }
215}
